metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Push Changes to Our GitHub Fork
We have made a lot of changes to our local Git.
content.html: We have made a lot of changes to our local Git.

content.text: Now we push them to our GitHub fork :
content.html: Now we push them to our GitHub fork:
commit the changes:

content.code:
git
push origin
Enumerating objects: 8, done.

content.text: Go to GitHub, and we see that the repository has a new commit. And we can send a Pull Request to the original repository:
content.html: Go to GitHub, and we see that the repository has a new commit. And we can send a Pull Request to the original repository:

content.text: Click that and create a pull request:
content.html: Click that and create a pull request:

content.text: Remember to add an explanation for the administrators.
content.html: Remember to add an explanation for the administrators.
Pull Request is sent:

content.text: Now any member with access can see the Pull Request when they see the original repository:
content.html: Now any member with access can see the Pull Request when they see the original repository:

content.text: And they can see the proposed changes:
content.html: And they can see the proposed changes:

content.text: Comment on the changes and merge :
content.html: Comment on the changes and merge:
Confirm:

content.text: And changes have been merged with master :
content.html: And changes have been merged with master:
Now you try!
